section.title: Description
section.p: This command triggers a cluster rebalance operation, this will redistribute all vbuckets evenly between all nodes currently in the cluster. Typically you would want to rebalance when adding a new nodes to a cluster or removing existing nodes.

Nodes can only be removed from a cluster as part of the rebalance command, using the --server-remove parameter. Usually nodes are added to a cluster and initialized using the server-add command before rebalancing .
section.note: Adding a server directly as part of the rebalance command using the --server-add parameter is deprecated and this functionality will be removed in a future release.
section.p: You can then cancel an ongoing rebalance using the Couchbase Web Console or using the rebalance-stop command.
